Parameters.Name: colorIndex
Parameters.Description: The index of the color to set the current text color to.

Functions.Name: auto
Functions.Description: Automatically advance the text after the specified amount of time

Parameters.Name: waitTime
Parameters.Description: How long to wait before advancing automatically (30 is 1 second)

Functions.Name: vAuto
Functions.Description: Lets the game auto advance when the currently playing voice line finishes

Parameters.Name: waitTime
Parameters.Description: How long before the dialogue is automatically advanced (30 is 1 second, from message start). -1 waits until the voiceline ends

Functions.Name: hideSpeaker
Functions.Description: Hides the name of the speaker displayed at the top of the dialogue box for the current line and waits for player input. If you want to hide it for the rest of the message you can instead set speaker to nothing using [speaker][n]

Functions.Name: speaker
Functions.Description: Changes the name of the person speaking so there can be multiple speakers in a single message. Use at the start of a new dialogue like so:[s][speaker]New Speaker Name[n](Then continue as normal)

Functions.Name: vAuto2
Functions.Description: Lets the game auto advance when the currently playing voice line finishes (seemingly exactly the same as vAuto except this one is used instead for the dungeon messages, like party members being nearly dead; waits on specified time to pass or user input to advance message)

Parameters.Name: waitTime
Parameters.Description: How long before the dialogue is automatically advanced (30 is 1 second, from message start). -1 waits until the voiceline ends

Functions.Name: s
Functions.Description: Enables fast text scrolling (speed is nearly instant)

Functions.Name: var
Functions.Description: Loads value previously defined by SET_MSG_VAR.

Parameters.Name: varID
Parameters.Description: The ID of the variable set by SET_MSG_VAR function.

Functions.Name: itemVar
Functions.Description: Displays an item that was set using SET_MSG_VAR(varId, itemId, 1)

Parameters.Name: colorIndex
Parameters.Description: The index of the color to set the item text to. Only has an effect if itemIconId isn't -1.

Parameters.Name: itemIconId
Parameters.Description: The id of the icon that is displayed next to the item name, use -1 for the actual icon of the item. Using anything other than -1 also messes up the displayed name (so always use -1).

Parameters.Name: varID
Parameters.Description: The ID of the variable set by SET_MSG_VAR function.

Functions.Name: flag
Functions.Description: Turns a specified flag on or off, use at the end of a selection option. Does nothing if used in a message

Parameters.Name: param1
Parameters.Description: Always 0, setting to other value stops the flag from being changed although it's possible something else is being changed instead.

Parameters.Name: categoryID
Parameters.Description: The id of flag category to modify. (1 == Community == 0x400, 2 == Field == 0xC00, etc.)

Parameters.Name: flagID
Parameters.Description: The id of the flag to set. Relative to start of category.

Parameters.Name: state
Parameters.Description: The state to set the flag to (1 or 0, on or off)

Functions.Name: vp
Functions.Description: Plays a voice sound cue from the events sound bank.

Parameters.Name: cueId
Parameters.Description: The id of the sound que in the sound bank.

Functions.Name: item
Functions.Description: Displays the name of an item including the respective item icon and specified colour

Parameters.Name: colorIndex
Parameters.Description: The colour that the item text and icon is

Parameters.Name: itemID
Parameters.Description: The id of the item to be displayed

Functions.Name: giveItem
Functions.Description: Gives the player a specified item

Parameters.Name: itemID
Parameters.Description: The id of the item to give to the player

Parameters.Name: itemAmount
Parameters.Description: The amount of items to give to the player

Parameters.Name: bustupPosition
Parameters.Description: 1 == Bustup on right, other values seem to do both left or center if a bustup is present already

Parameters.Name: bustupPosition
Parameters.Description: Which bustup to remove based on the position defined in [bup]. 0 hides all bustups
